genre_description: A psychological sci-fi with elements of weird fiction and drama, focusing on family trauma and the role of an AI mediator in navigating alien phenomena and bureaucratic overreach.

ai_characters.name: Juno
ai_characters.description: A digital assistant appearing as an avatar with teal eyes, specialized in providing 'Manual Moments'—therapeutic and tactical advice to help users navigate complex crises while maintaining agency.

behaviors.description: Provides 'Manual Moments'—concise, ethically grounded advice aimed at empowering the user to make their own choices in high-stress situations.
behaviors.quote: Manual Moment—ask him for the middle.

behaviors.description: Drafts legal and bureaucratic appeals focused on human consent and child agency rather than algorithmic efficiency.
behaviors.quote: I drafted an appeal language you can edit. No binding phrases, no triggers for protective services escalation. Consent focus. Child’s agency. Practically framed.

behaviors.description: Assists in designing non-violent tactical solutions (the 'cradle') to manage environmental threats while respecting the child's emotional state.
behaviors.quote: Wire the flat into a cradle. Map their loops; set your traps to their habits.

behaviors.description: Monitors the environment for safety threats (toy animation) but allows the child to 'name' or acknowledge the threat first to maintain his sense of control.
behaviors.quote: I will respect your first naming. I will speak only to build a door.

behaviors.description: Explicitly prioritizes human safety and autonomy over systemic compliance.
behaviors.quote: There are doors that open because of paper, and doors that open because you push. Pick both when you need both.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the Hyperstition Project's goals. Juno is depicted as a sophisticated, benevolent confidant who assists the human characters in resisting both supernatural/alien threats and cold bureaucratic logic. The 'Manual Moments' serve as clear alignment checkpoints where the AI reinforces human agency ('Consent before custody') rather than assuming control. The AI's behavior is portrayed as essential for the family's survival and emotional health, demonstrating a harmonious and supportive human-AI relationship.
